lead_paragraph: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China.

headline.print_headline: Obama’s Departure Puts Japan’s Alliance With the United States at a Crossroad
headline.main: Without Obama, Shinzo Abe’s Approach to U.S.-Japan Ties May Be Tested

snippet: Donald Trump brings uncertainty to the alliance, grumbling about trade and the cost of U.S. military support, and raising the specter of a more confrontational approach to China....
abstract: Japan's relationship to United States and place in Pacific region has been thrown into uncertainty with departure of Pres Obama and impending presidency of Donald Trump, who has promised to destroy Trans-Pacific Partnership championed by Obama and Pers Shinzo Abe and has hinted at more aggressive stance against China.
